result.execSummary:
The defendant Carol L Weggen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Injury by Use/Vehicle-Control. Substance, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.25(1)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs, DNA and Transcript fee (to DA's office)  to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
**12/22/2016 CASH BAIL APPLIED TO COSTS, PAID IN FULL. 

AS OF 3-30-2018: Per the 2-28-18 Court of Appeals decision the 12/22/2016 Order is vacated.
Court costs, DNA and transcript fee to DA's  to be paid as a condition of probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No contact with any victims or their/residence/property.
Provide DNA sample if not previously done.

Restitution of $29,176.91 to be paid as a condition of probation.
($12,936.18 to American Family, $11,240.73 to Crime victim fund and $5,000.00 to Progressive Insurance)
AS OF 12/10/2015: Restitution was amended to: $7,740.73 (Crime Victim Fund)
$5,000.00 BAIL WAS APPLED that was held in trust. Balance of $2,740.73 and surcharges to be paid as a Condition to Probation.
12/22/2016 COURT GRANTS ORDER FOR RESTITUTION TO BE VACATED. MONIES ORIGINALLY APPLIED TO BE ADJUSTED TO COVER COURT COSTS.

AS OF 3/30/2018: Per the 2/28/18 Court of Appeals decision the 12/22/16 order is vacated.
$5,000.00 bail was forwarded to Crime Victim Compensation. Restitution has been paid in full.

Condition Time - 9 months huber - Last 4 months STAYED and to be used at Agent's discretion. Agent to determine with or without non working hours.
